features.name: Slayer Proficiencies
features.desc: A slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Studied Target
features.desc:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Studied Target (Swift)
features.desc:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Advanced Talents
features.desc: After 10th level, a character can choose one of the advanced rogue talents in place of a rogue talent.

features.name: Slayer's Advance
features.desc: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.

features.name: Quarry
features.desc: A character can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, denote one target within his line of sight as his quarry. He receives a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made against his quarry, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats are automatically confirmed. A character can have no more than one quarry at a time.

features.name: Slayer's Advance
features.desc: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.

features.name: Improved Quarry
features.desc: At 19th level, the character's ability to hunt his quarry improves. He can now select a quarry as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} and his insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} his quarry increases to +4.

features.name: Master Slayer
features.desc: At 20th level, the slayer becomes a master at capturing or killing his studied targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a studied target at his full attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. If the attack succeeds, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for this save is 10 + 1/2 the slayer's level + the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any slayer) for 24 hours.

features.name: Vanguard Tactician
features.desc:
At 2nd level, a vanguard receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the vanguard can grant one of his teamwork feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 levels the vanguard possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of this bonus feat. Whenever the vanguard is able to select a new slayer talent, he can instead choose to gain an additional use per day of this ability.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.

features.name: Teamwork Feat
features.desc:
At 2nd level, a vanguard receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the vanguard can grant one of his teamwork feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 levels the vanguard possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of this bonus feat. Whenever the vanguard is able to select a new slayer talent, he can instead choose to gain an additional use per day of this ability.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.

features.name: Vanguard's Bond
features.desc:
At 4th level, a vanguard forms a bond with his fighting companions. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, he can choose one of his current studied targets and grant half his studied target {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against that target to all allies. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 4th level.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.

features.name: Determined Zeal
features.desc:
At 2nd level, a deliverer shrugs off attempts by his moral opposite to control or kill him. On any {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in which deliverer {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} an opponent whose {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} is at least two steps away from his own (such as a lawful good deliverer fighting a chaotic good or lawful evil foe, or a neutral foe with no other alignment components), he gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against that opponent's abilities, as well as the benefit of the Diehard {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} until the end of his next turn.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.

features.name: Divine Anathema
features.desc:
At 10th level, if the studied target's {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} is at least two steps away from that of the deliverer, the deliverer's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}; this damage is directly from divine power.
This ability replaces the advanced slayer talent gained at 10th level.

features.name: Studied Spawn — Large
features.desc:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, as do the DCs of slayer abilities against a studied target increase by 1. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters Studied Target.

features.name: Studied Spawn — Huge
features.desc:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, as do the DCs of slayer abilities against a studied target increase by 1. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters Studied Target.

features.name: Studied Spawn — Gargantuan
features.desc:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, as do the DCs of slayer abilities against a studied target increase by 1. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters Studied Target.

features.name: Studied Spawn — Colossal
features.desc:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, as do the DCs of slayer abilities against a studied target increase by 1. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters Studied Target.

features.name: Gain Leverage
features.desc: At 7th level, a spawn slayer learns techniques to counteract a foe's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} advantage. When performing a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against a studied target of Large or larger size, the spawn slayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} equal to the creature's size modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} (Large +1, Huge +2, Gargantuan +4, and Colossal +8). The spawn slayer adds this same bonus to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against combat maneuvers from a Large or larger studied target.

features.name: Focused Killer
features.desc: At 1st level, an executioner's studied target {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} and the DCs of the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against his slayer abilities increase by 1 against humanoid opponents, but decrease by 1 against non-humanoid targets.

features.name: Painful Strike
features.desc: At 4th level, an executioner automatically gains this talent. A creature that takes sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from an executioner must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the executioner's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) or become sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.

features.name: Assassinate
features.desc:
At 10th level, an executioner can target studied opponents in attempt to instantly kill them. This ability can only be used out of combat and the target must not see the executioner, apart from that its effects are similar to the coup de grace ability.
At 14th level, whenever an executioner kills an enemy with assassinate, all other enemies in a 30-foot radius become demoralized.
At 19th level, whenever an enemy survives an assassinate attempt by an executioner, it suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.

features.name: Stygian Slayer Proficiencies
features.desc: A stygian slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, but not with medium armor, heavy armor, or any kind of shields (including tower shields).

features.name: Invisibility
features.desc: At 4th level, a stygian slayer can cast invisibility once per day, using his slayer level as his {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The slayer uses his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier for {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} when using this ability. The slayer can use this an additional time per day at 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

features.name: Shadowy Mist Form
features.desc: At 10th level, a stygian slayer can transform into an inky black cloud of mist. This functions as {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g} form, in which slayer can not {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The slayer can use this ability for a number of minutes per day equal to his level. These minutes need not be consecutive, but must be used in 1-minute increments.

features.name: Arcane Reservoir
features.desc:
An arcanist has an innate pool of magical energy that she can draw upon to fuel her arcanist exploits and enhance her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. The arcanist's arcane reservoir can hold a maximum amount of magical energy equal to 3 + the arcanist's level. Each day, when preparing spells, the arcanist's arcane reservoir fills with raw magical energy, gaining a number of points equal to 3 + half her arcanist level. Any points she had from the previous day are lost. She can also regain these points through the consume spells class feature and some arcanist exploits. The arcane reservoir can never hold more points than the maximum amount noted above; points gained in excess of this total are lost.
Points from the arcanist reservoir are used to fuel many of the arcanist's powers. In addition, the arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} whenever she casts an arcanist spell. If she does, she can choose to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.

features.name: Arcanist Exploits
features.desc: By bending and sometimes even breaking the rules of magic, the arcanist learns to exploit gaps and exceptions in the laws of magic. Some of these exploits allow her to break down various forms of magic, adding their essence to her arcane reservoir. At 1st level and every 2 levels thereafter, the arcanist learns a new arcane exploit. An arcanist exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once an arcanist exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most arcanist exploits require the arcanist to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an arcanist exploit is equal to 10 + half the arcanist's level + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.

features.name: Greater Exploits
features.desc: At 11th level and every 2 levels thereafter, an arcanist can choose one of the greater exploits in place of an arcanist exploit.

features.name: Imitation
features.desc: An imitator can imitate the martial class style which allows him to take fighter, barbarian, rogue or monk stance for 1 minute a number of times per day equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier + half the slayer level.
